item.title: Turtles discovered in Dumaresq Dam could be dumped pets
item.description: The unexpected discovery of four turtle species in a dam near Armidale has left researchers wondering if people have been dumping unwanted pets.

item.title: Savannah Guthrie makes latest video plea as missing mother's ransom deadline nears
item.description: US TV host Savannah Guthrie says her family is at its "hour of desperation" in the search for their kidnapped mother, but makes no mention of a possible ransom in a new video.

item.title: Barnaby Joyce taps into rural anger as One Nation eyes Coalition seats at the Victorian election
item.description: The right-wing party's prized recruit, Barnaby Joyce, made a key appearance deep in National Party territory as the 2026 Victorian election campaign began to take shape, Richard Willingham writes.

item.title: Catherine O'Hara's cause of death revealed as pulmonary embolism
item.description: Award-winning actress Catherine O'Hara died from a pulmonary embolism, according to her death certificate.

item.title: Border Force launches operation targeting illegal foreign fishing off Queensland coast
item.description: Authorities announce a special effort to crack down on illegal foreign fishing boats after intercepting 10 boats in Queensland waters since New Year's Day alone.

item.title: AI-generated social media posts like a 'snake eating its own tail'
item.description: The age of AI is here and it's going to be infinitely useful, or so they tell us, unless you're the kind of person who, like me, finds computer-generated stories infinitely boring and an insult to humanity.

item.title: Bondi Beach terrorist Sajid Akram voiced support for Islamic State in 2019, former ASIO agent says
item.description: Bondi Beach terrorist Sajid Akram voiced support for the Islamic State group (IS) in 2019 and expressed admiration for a leading Al Qaeda propagandist, according to accounts from two men who moved in the same extremist circles.

item.title: Licensed program to kill native animals 'weak' and 'outdated' inquiry told
item.description: Animal welfare groups are calling for a major overhaul into the system that allows native animals to be killed in NSW.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell was complicit in Jeffrey Epstein's abuse. Now she's pushing for clemency
item.description: Powerful socialite Ghislaine Maxwell was able to exploit her connections to recruit, groom, and abuse dozens of young girls. Now, she faces a fresh interrogation over her role in Jeffrey Epstein's abuse.

item.title: Christchurch attacker was pleased when terrorism charge laid, court hears
item.description: A former lawyer for the Australian who murdered 51 people at two New Zealand mosques in 2019 tells a court the shooter "never wanted to defend the terrorism charge".

item.title: Huon Aquaculture confirms antibiotic use in salmon hatchery on River Derwent
item.description: There are calls for the public to be made aware of antibiotic use in Tasmania's freshwater hatcheries after Huon Aquaculture recently used oxytetracycline to treat diseased salmon without informing downstream users.

item.title: Exploitation claims have been levelled against cruise ship company Carnival. Here's what we know
item.description: A major cruise ship has been investigated by the maritime safety regulator for claims around poor working conditions. A spokesperson for The Carnival Cruise Line says it has "nothing to hide" and welcomes AMSA's oversight. Here's what we know so far.

item.title: Sydney man avoids jail over 'abhorrent' social media posts
item.description: A Sydney man who made "abhorrent" social media posts that promoted sexual violence and threatened the prime minister has been spared time in custody.

item.title: Hundreds rally against police response to night of violent protest clashes in Sydney
item.description: Hundreds of protesters have gathered outside a police station in Sydney to criticise the force's response to Monday night's rally against the visit of Israeli President Isaac Herzog.

item.title: Mackay MP Nigel Dalton crosses the floor to oppose LNP ban on abortion debate
item.description: First-term Liberal National Party MP Nigel Dalton votes to overturn a ban on debating abortion — in defiance of his party.

item.title: Grace Tame criticised for leading intifada chants at Sydney protest
item.description: Grace Tame accuses Australia of being "a so-called democracy" that punishes peaceful protesters, before chanting "from Gadigal to Gaza, globalise the intifada!"

item.title: Deadline looms for Warren Tredrea to pay Nine's legal costs after failed appeal against unfair dismissal case
item.description: Former footballer Warren Tredrea has an imminent deadline to pay $149,000 to his former employer, Channel Nine, following a failed appeal against an unfair dismissal case.

item.title: At school, I was my brother's protector. But I needed more support
item.description: I was my brother's protector at school, but the education system could have done more to support us both.

item.title: Craig Goodwin's World Cup hopes cop hammer blow after groin injury
item.description: He was one of the Socceroos best in Qatar but now Craig Goodwin will need a minor miracle to make this year's World Cup after the veteran suffered a groin injury for Adelaide United that will sideline him for some time.

item.title: Shark filmed in deep Antarctic waters
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Elvis Presley 'unguarded' in unseen footage used in new Baz Luhrmann film
item.description: When director Baz Luhrmann and his team uncovered hours of previously unseen Elvis Presley recordings, Luhrmann abandoned his original plans, deciding to "get out of the way" and let Presley tell his own story.

item.title: Tahmoor Coal placed into administration as court hears creditor winding-up bid
item.description: Tahmoor Coal has been placed into voluntary administration just as the Supreme Court was set to hear a creditor's winding-up application.

item.title: Queensland government appoints tenderers for new oil and gas exploration in Taroom Trough
item.description: The Queensland government approves new oil and gas exploration in a region they believe could become Australia's first new major oil province in 50 years.

item.title: Ex-student tells court of pregnancy scare after alleged abuse by Hobart Matriculation College teacher
item.description: When recounting the first time her former teacher allegedly raped her, the woman told the court he was "like a big monster" on top of her and she "could hardly breathe". The woman is suing both her former teacher and the State of Tasmania.

item.title: Raymond Reddington murder trial hears Sharon Fulton seemed scared in hours before 1986 disappearance
item.description: A close friend of a woman allegedly murdered by her husband in Perth 40 years ago tells a Perth court she seemed frightened in the hours before her disappearance.

item.title: Top barrister and charity boss Mark Philip Dennis dead after child abuse arrest
item.description: The 60-year-old was found dead at his Leichhardt unit in Sydney's inner west on Monday evening, NSW Police said in a statement.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Australian government puts pressure on Lao authorities over methanol poisoning deaths
item.description: The Australian government calls in the Lao ambassador in Canberra, amid criticism of the country's response to a fatal methanol poisoning.

item.title: Former NT police officer James Kirstenfeldt sentenced on drink driving, weapons offences
item.description: A former Northern Territory police officer has been ordered to pay almost $5,000 in fines and undergo supervised treatment for post-traumatic stress disorder after drunkenly crashing his car outside his suburban Darwin home.

item.title: Health warnings about ultra-processed foods
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: WA police investigate possible tobacco wars link to fire at Kelmscott store
item.description: WA Police Commissioner Col Blanch confirms officers from Taskforce Maverick, which investigates crime linked to the illicit tobacco and vape trade, are involved with the investigation.

item.title: Police warn against 'false hope' as cold case search bones identified as 'non‑human'
item.description: Bone fragments found during a private search for evidence relating to the disappearance of two girls in 1973 are "not human remains", according to police, who have issued a public warning against actions that create "false hope".

item.title: Three key moments in police clashes with Sydney protesters
item.description: Competing narratives have emerged from NSW Police and protesters who were at Monday night's demonstration near Sydney's Town Hall. ABC NEWS Verify has gathered footage and spoken to witnesses in an early attempt to examine what happened in detail.

item.title: ASIO ordered independent review into Bondi terror case, stands by 2019 assessment
item.description: The nation's top spy has welcomed a royal commission into the Bondi terror attack, vowing to "own any mistakes" uncovered by the probe as his agency comes under pressure over whether the tragedy could have been prevented.

item.title: The desperate toll of Australia's 2026 Winter Olympic Games injury chaos
item.description: Games-ending injuries to Cam Bolton and Misaki Vaughan have emphasised the dangers of winter sport as the Australian team copes with issues early in the Milano Cortina Games.

item.title: Israel tightens grip over West Bank while Herzog visits Australia
item.description: While Israeli President Isaac Herzog visited Sydney, his government was taking concrete actions in the West Bank designed to "continue to kill the idea of a Palestinian state".

item.title: FBI releases surveillance pictures of masked man at Nancy Guthrie's home on morning she disappeared
item.description: FBI director Kash Patel has posted the images on social media, saying they had been recovered after days of work by investigators.

item.title: Protesters were punched, pushed, and arrested but were NSW Police actions excessive?
item.description: What is reasonable? It's a question being asked by some after footage of clashes in Sydney's CBD, during a rally against Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit.

item.title: The Epstein files are shaking Britain, but Donald Trump could still have 3 million reasons to worry
item.description: Donald Trump's enemies made no secret of their hopes the documents would contain something explosive enough to bring the president down, but right now the Epstein spotlight is on Britain's politicians and palaces.

item.title: Uber quietly agrees to external review after woman sues over guide dog refusals
item.description: Uber quietly agrees to an external review of its Australian operations after settling a Federal Court case brought by a woman refused more than 30 rides while travelling with a guide dog.

item.title: Jakara Anthony picture perfect, Matt Graham with room to improve at 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games moguls
item.description: Jakara Anthony will do anything aside from thinking about moguls skiing after qualifying number one for Wednesday's 2026 Winter Olympics final, taking to Lego, a puzzle and Grey's Anatomy instead.

item.title: SA Liberals face wipeout not seen since state bank election
item.description: Labor faced a humiliating election loss following the state bank collapse in the early 90s. Now, recent polling shows a collapse of another kind could be brewing for the Liberal Party with One Nation hot on its heels.

item.title: Food ministers move closer to mandating Health Star Ratings on packaged food
item.description: The nation's food ministers will this week take a crucial step towards mandating the Health Star Rating scheme on packaged food products.

item.title: How to reduce loneliness while working remotely
item.description: Working remotely can be a lonely experience. Here's what you can do about it.

item.title: Hume City Council wants action over thousands of tyres dumped in Melbourne's north
item.description: A council in Melbourne's north wants the federal government to establish a free tyre recycling scheme to stop thousands of tyres being dumped, causing a potential environmental hazard.

item.title: Cricket umpire numbers rise since COVID, but regions still in 'dire' need
item.description: Cricket umpire numbers increase significantly in Victoria, but some regions remain in desperate need.

item.title: Angus Taylor resigns from Liberal frontbench ahead of expected leadership spill — as it happened
item.description: Angus Taylor has resigned from the shadow frontbench ahead of an expected Liberal leadership spill.

item.title: Australian T20 World Cup squad looks different but do not count it out, Mitch Marsh says
item.description: Despite a slew of key injuries leaving the Australian team unrecognisable, captain Mitch Marsh is confident about the experience left in the side.

item.title: Limestone Coast hospital's staff shortage in spotlight after former administrator's fall
item.description: David Walshaw spent 20 years looking after the Limestone Coast's hospitals, but a fall made him realise the system was failing patients.

item.title: ASX 200 rallies as CBA surges, Aussie dollar above 71 US cents — as it happened
item.description: The Australian share market has finished strongly after the first "big day" of reporting season with good earnings news for the Commonwealth Bank for the first half of the financial year. Look back on our live blog.

item.title: Surgeon Kelvin Kong's life growing up Chinese and Indigenous in Australia
item.description: Australia's first identified First Nations surgeon, Dr Kelvin Kong spoke about his Malaysian Chinese heritage during the annual Wang Gungwu lecture at Parliament House.

item.title: Citizen scientists work on 100-million-year-old ichthyosaur fossil in Winton
item.description: Participants from across Australia and the world travelled to outback Queensland to clean up the near-complete ichthyosaur fossil.

item.title: Images of alleged tobacco wars kingpin Kazem Hamad released in Iraq
item.description: Hamad was deported from Australia in 2023 and has been a key person of interest relating to firebombings at Victorian tobacco shops and businesses.

item.title: Trump told police chief 'everyone' knew about Epstein, FBI document says
item.description: Donald Trump allegedly told police in 2006 that people in New York knew about Epstein, a newly uncovered FBI interview shows.

item.title: Volunteers say neglect by state's wildlife department caused bushfires on WA's south coast
item.description: Farmers and volunteer firefighters say decades of neglect by WA's Department of Biodiversity, Conservation and Attractions is at the heart of fires that ripped through more than 200,000 hectares of state-managed land.

item.title: Western quoll joey born in outback NSW likely to be first in a century
item.description: Once thought to be extinct in NSW, the small, spotted, and highly photogenic western quoll is making a hard-fought comeback to the wild.

item.title: Fateful wrong turn, quiet cancer battle possible factors in missing prospector's suspected death
item.description: An inquest into Barry Podmore's disappearance in WA's remote Wheatbelt hears the 73-year-old was waging a private battle with cancer and may have become lost in bushland.

item.title: What 30 years on the domestic violence front line taught police negotiator Vincent Hurley
item.description: Years on the front line of domestic violence surfaced in a frustration-filled moment on national television for Vincent Hurley. He explains what motivates him to keep fighting for change.

item.title: Race against bulldozers to save ancient grass trees in WA's South West
item.description: Some of WA's oldest grass trees are being rescued from land clearing and development amid a population and property boom, preserving a unique part of the South West's natural heritage.

item.title: Queensland records first outbreak of Mimosa pigra — giant sensitive tree — in 25 years
item.description: A giant sensitive tree infestation has been detected near a lake near Brisbane and authorities say they have "no idea" how it got there.

item.title: Dungeons and Dragons-inspired game breaks down social barriers for neurodivergent kids
item.description: An Adelaide clinical psychologist creates a simplified version of Dungeons and Dragons to help neurodivergent children and young people learn social skills and develop peer connections.

item.title: Socceroos striker Mo Toure scores hat-trick on starting debut in English Championship for Norwich
item.description: Mohamed Toure moved to England recently on a $5 million deal and it is already looking like a great decision for the 21-year-old forward.

item.title: Perth Festival opens with outdoor music, light sculptures and stories shared via old red telephone
item.description: Australia's longest running arts event, the Perth Festival, began on the weekend with Humans of New York-style videos in which locals tell their stories using an old red telephone on a bridge.

item.title: DPP apologises after office 'dropped the ball' over police officer assault case
item.description: A court decision in which a woman who assaulted a South Australian police officer with a glass bottle was spared jail prompts an extraordinary concession from the Director of Public Prosecutions (DPP).

item.title: Person detained for questioning over disappearance of Nancy Guthrie, Arizona law enforcement says
item.description: Law officials in Arizona say a person has been detained for questioning in relation to the disappearance of Nancy Guthrie, the 84-year-old mother of Today show host Savannah.

item.title: Police say there was 'serious, imminent risk' of child kidnapping in Perth by Jason William Forbes
item.description: WA Police say "something terrible" could have happened if there was a delay in intercepting a Baldivis man who planned to abduct and sexually abuse a child in Perth.

item.title: Formula 1 2026: New engines and no DRS headline major changes in grand prix
item.description: New engines, new regulations and an 11-team grid are just some of the changes in Formula 1 this season. Get up to speed with what is new in F1 ahead of the Australian Grand Prix.

item.title: Doongmabulla Springs decision leaves Qld government to weigh appeal or face trial
item.description: Wangan and Jagalingou peoples await the state government's next move after a win in their fight to have alleged damage to a sacred site near a mine in Central Queensland investigated.

item.title: No body-worn video evidence available for inquest into Krista Kach's death, coroner hears
item.description: A court hears a NSW inquest will need to rely on eyewitness accounts of the 2023 death of Krista Kach, who was shot with a beanbag round following a 10-hour stand-off with police in 2023.

item.title: What to watch in February, from puppy love to Muppet hijinks
item.description: Kermit, Miss Piggy and the rest of the crew are back to celebrate their 50th birthday with a one-off special that has the potential to turn into a whole new series for the beloved characters.

item.title: Dinosaur dig on Victoria's Bass Coast uncovers more than 60 bones and fossils
item.description: A collection of more than 60 dinosaur bones and fossils are unearthed from rocks at the site of a fossil dig in Victoria's south-east.

item.title: Perth brothers Nezir and Enver Ibrahimovic avoid jail for assault at Scarborough bar
item.description: Two brothers working as bouncers when they assaulted a man at a Scarborough bar avoid jail after a magistrate recognised the trauma they suffered in the Bosnian war.

item.title: Cryptosporidium cluster at Waterworld leads to closure of Adelaide Aquatic Centre pools
item.description: SA Health is urging people with gastroenteritis symptoms not to visit public swimming pools after eight cases at one swimming centre, including one child who was hospitalised and another who also visited the Adelaide Aquatic Centre.

item.title: Axed literary magazine Meanjin is resurrected by Queensland University of Technology
item.description: The 85-year-old literary journal Meanjin will return to Brisbane, where it was first published, after it was controversially closed by Melbourne University Press last year.

item.title: Telstra to axe up to 650 roles in mass redundancy round, some jobs to be outsourced to India
item.description: Telstra notifies staff of plans to outsource hundreds of jobs to an India-based technology company.

item.title: Former Carlton legend Peter Dean hospitalised after serious assault in Albury
item.description: Former AFL player Peter Dean is recovering in hospital after he sustained serious head and facial injuries in an alleged assault at Albury on the New South Wales Victorian border.

item.title: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Mitchell brings damage and rain to farmers in WA's south
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says a weather system influenced by ex-Tropical Cyclone Mitchell delivered storms to the Great Southern and central Wheatbelt this week.

item.title: Storms smash WA's Wheatbelt region
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: US politician Ro Khanna reveals names of six 'powerful men' scrubbed from Epstein files
item.description: US politician Ro Khanna has publicly named six men whose identities were scrubbed from the Epstein files, including the former boss of Victoria's Secret, who the FBI suspected was a co-conspirator of the sex offender's crimes.

item.title: Supersized fatberg clogging Sydney sewer blamed for mysterious debris balls on beach
item.description: The debris balls that have washed up on NSW beaches in recent years are likely to continue as Sydney Water admits a massive fatberg it cannot reach is clogging sewers.

item.title: NSW soccer coach Tullio 'Tony' Giacomo Cigana jailed over child abuse material
item.description: A once well-regarded soccer coach has been handed a 12 month jail sentence for possessing child abuse material, after a Sydney court heard he has been disowned by family members.

item.title: Bondi: Path to Terror
item.description: Four Corners is the home of Australian investigative journalism.

item.title: What we know about the mass shooting in Tumbler Ridge, Canada
item.description: Police confirmed the suspect was a woman but have yet to identify the victims of the mass shooting that left nine people, including the alleged shooter, dead in the rural town.

item.title: Hundreds treated for e-bike injuries in 2025 at Sydney St Vincent Hospital
item.description: More than 200 people were treated for e-bike related injuries at a single Sydney hospital last year, with one medical professor describing the trend as an "epidemic".

item.title: Australian fans miss out on World Cup tickets as prices skyrocket
item.description: A host of Australian fans will be denied the chance to watch the Socceroos World Cup campaign amid accusations of price gouging by FIFA as tickets to the tournament soar to astronomical prices.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Australia cruises to victory over Ireland in T20 World Cup opener
item.description: Australia beats Ireland by 67 runs to win its first game at the T20 World Cup, after captain Mitch Marsh was a late out due to testicular bleeding.

item.title: Channel Nine says Warren Tredrea has now paid costs over long-running legal battle
item.description: Channel Nine has confirmed it has received legal costs from former AFL player and sports presenter Warren Tredrea, who was ordered to pay $149,000 to his ex-employer.

item.title: Is there going to be a Liberal leadership showdown?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: More homes in Daly River damaged by flooding, with water levels expected to recede from Thursday
item.description: Floodwaters have spilled inside "quite a number of homes" in the remote Northern Territory town of Daly River, authorities say, with still-rising water levels delaying the return home for evacuated locals.

item.title: Britney Spears sells rights to music catalogue in reported $281m deal
item.description: Spears is the latest music star to sell the rights to their work, a decade after the release of her ninth and last studio album.

item.title: Jakara Anthony may not have won Winter Olympics moguls gold, but winning is not always measured in medals
item.description: Disaster stared Jakara Anthony in the face and meted out the cruellest of injustices as she missed out on a moguls medal at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games. But her response showed us the character that should make Australia proud regardless.

item.title: The identities linked to corruption at the CFMEU, according to Queensland's Commission of Inquiry
item.description: Members of bikie gangs, convicted murderers and violent criminals are among more than 25 people who allegedly benefited from or are linked to corrupt behaviour at the CFMEU, according to a report.

item.title: Crack found in new $786m Bridgewater Bridge, RTI documents reveal
item.description: Days before the official opening, the Tasmanian government's largest-ever infrastructure project hit a hurdle, with a large crack picked up in one of the Bridgewater Bridge's piers detected and fixed, documents show.

item.title: Kath & Kim is back on ABC iview. Test your Fountain Lakes fan credentials with our quiz. It's noice, it's different, it's _____
item.description: It's an Aussie classic, but do you know who delivered these iconic lines in Kath & Kim? Put down your cardonnay and footy franks and show us what you've got.

item.title: Angus Taylor is moving to challenge Sussan Ley — but not on his terms
item.description: Angus Taylor was holidaying in Europe when his colleagues began manoeuvring to topple Sussan Ley. A leadership spill this week wasn't what he or Sussan Ley wanted.

item.title: Transparency concerns as Bougainville's Panguna mine that sparked civil war on path to reopen
item.description: The Autonomous Bougainville Government signs a secretive deal to reopen the huge Panguna gold and copper mine that sparked a catastrophic civil war three decades ago.

item.title: Australia's toxic legacy at Wilkes Station in Antarctica
item.description: The ABC has been given rare access to an abandoned Australian base in Antarctica that continues to pose a threat to the environment.

item.title: Old Bureau of Meteorology website still getting thousands of clicks
item.description: The new BOM website is still drawing criticism, with 400,000 users turning to the old site, despite $1.15 million in recent updates.

item.title: The weekend Adelaide becomes a Saudi Arabian sports utopia
item.description: Saudi Arabia’s LIV Golf project is facing plenty of problems across the world, but you would not read about it when the circus flies into Adelaide.

item.title: Australia Diamonds defeat Jamaica 80-33 in third netball Test to claim 3-0 series win
item.description: Coach Stacey Marinkovich believes a refreshed Diamonds squad has found its "identity" ahead of attempting to become the first Australian netball team to defend Commonwealth Games gold.

item.title: A look at the ballistic missile program Iran refuses to negotiate on
item.description: Iran has spent decades building the largest and most diverse ballistic missile stockpile in the Middle East and is refusing US demands to put limits on the weapons program.

item.title: Thirty people stranded by floods in outback NT angry at police
item.description: A day trip to the Tjoritja/West MacDonnell National Park became a 24-hour ordeal for almost 30 people when the Hugh River unexpectedly cut off Namatjira Drive, 50 kilometres from Alice Springs.

item.description: A man has been charged with animal cruelty a year after neighbours first made a complaint to the RSPCA.

item.title: Lando Norris quickest on day one of F1 preseason test, Oscar Piastri drives well and Max Verstappen impresses
item.description: McLaren's Formula 1 world champion Lando Norris was fastest on the first day of preseason testing in Bahrain, but Max Verstappen and Red Bull caught the attention with pace and plenty of laps.

item.title: Baker Boy talks new album Djandjay, Riverboats festival and family legacy
item.description: The Yolŋu artist known as the Fresh Prince of Arnhem Land is the king of feel-good bilingual bangers. But heavy is the crown.

item.title: James Van Der Beek, star of Dawson's Creek, dies aged 48 after colorectal cancer diagnosis
item.description: The American actor was best known for his starring role as Dawson Leery in Dawson's Creek from 1998 to 2003.

item.title: Canada school shooter 18-year-old Jesse Van Rootselaar acted alone, police say
item.description: Police identify the person who carried out a school massacre in a remote Canadian community as an 18-year-old woman with mental health issues.

item.title: Severe weather warning issued for heavy rain across south-east Queensland
item.description: A severe weather warning has been issued for south-east Queensland after a day of scorching heat.

item.title: Liberal frontbench resignations snowball as Ley backer resigns — as it happened
item.description: Angus Taylor has confirmed he will challenge Opposition Leader Sussan Ley for the leadership at the meeting.

item.title: Pam Bondi grilled over Epstein files as survivors express fury over redactions
item.description: US Attorney-General Pam Bondi faces furious questions over the censorship of names in the Epstein files at a heated hearing before a committee of Congress.

item.title: RBA concedes 'our forecasts are often wrong'
item.description: Asked by a journalist, "Was it perhaps overenthusiastic to cut interest rates three times?" The RBA's chief economist responded, "Forecasting is really difficult business, our forecasts are often wrong ... it is what it is."

item.title: Australians feel divided as Albanese asks to 'turn the temperature down'
item.description: Most Australians want greater social cohesion here, even if they don't see much of it right now.

item.title: Carers WA struggling to cope with unprecedented demand for support services
item.description: An organisation that helps people caring for vulnerable family members in WA is experiencing unprecedented demand, with services unable to keep up with the community's needs.

item.title: Future of Port Hedland's West End uncertain after buyback scheme ends
item.description: As Port Hedland's controversial dust buyback scheme winds up, Pilbara Ports quietly walks away from major plans to build a training facility and accommodation, with development plans for the area still uncertain.

item.title: Authorities warn Alice Springs flash flooding threat isn't over, more Central Australian rain predicted
item.description: Authorities are warning Alice Springs could face further flooding overnight, with forecasts of more wet weather posing a threat to slowly receding water levels.

item.title: Dispute over West Bank football pitch sparks international campaign
item.description: A campaign to save a West Bank football pitch from demolition has gone global. The sport's most powerful bodies, as well as social media influencers, have intervened to pressure Israeli authorities to reconsider its destruction.

item.title: Protesters march through Melbourne's CBD as Israeli President Isaac Herzog concludes visit
item.description: Thousands of people have marched through Melbourne's CBD in protest as Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit to the Australia winds up.

item.title: South Africa beats Afghanistan at Twenty20 World Cup after two super overs at Narendra Modi Stadium
item.description: South Africa wins the most dramatic T20 World Cup group stage clash with Afghanistan, featuring two super overs and countless twists of fortune.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Lindsey Vonn has successful surgery as Vladyslav Heraskevych wears his banned helmet — quick hits from day five
item.description: A Ukrainian athlete is refusing to back down over a controversial helmet featuring the dead, Lindsey Vonn has a third surgery, and maple syrup has powered Ryan Cochran-Siegle to another medal. Here are the quick hits from the Winter Olympics.

item.title: FBI combs desert terrain for clues in Nancy Guthrie's disappearance
item.description: The man detained for questioning in the investigation into the disappearance of a US TV show host's mother has been released and the search continues.

item.title: Declining birth rates in southern right whales alarm researchers in new study
item.description: New research on the birth rates of southern right whales – once touted as a global conservation success story – has revealed an alarming decline.

item.title: Mackay MP who crossed floor to oppose LNP ban on abortion debate defends actions
item.description: Mackay MP Nigel Dalton crossed the floor on Tuesday to vote with Katter's Australian Party to end a parliamentary ban on abortion debate.

item.title: Public DNA databases lead to arrest over historical NSW sexual assault cases
item.description: A 77-year-old man is arrested in connection with a string of alleged sexual assaults in NSW dating back to the 1990s.

item.title: Scotty James and Valentino Guseli raise their level at 'unbelievable' snowboard halfpipe qualifier at Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Scotty James is the man to beat in the snowboard halfpipe at the 2026 Winter Olympics, but a stunning qualifying competition proves that the final is going to be on another level entirely.

item.title: UK police to decide on Andrew Mounbatten-Windsor Epstein trade document investigation
item.description: British police say they are "making progress as quickly as possible" on whether to launch a full investigation into allegations that Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor shared confidential trade documents with late financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Three arrested by CFMEU corruption taskforce as premier insists she took appropriate action
item.description: The arrests were made hours before Premier Jacinta Allan faced reporters over separate allegations detailed in a new report that $15 billion in taxpayer dollars had made its way into the hands of criminals who had infiltrated the union.

item.title: Chris Minns has cracked down on protests. Will it pay off?
item.description: By expanding police powers and allowing bans on authorised public assemblies the Minns government has made restricting protest a defining feature of its first term.

item.title: Video shows Guildford shooting victim pleading for help from neighbours
item.description: Vision shows the moment a bleeding man shot in Sydney's south-west overnight begs for help in a neighbour's back yard.

item.title: 5,000 cannabis plants seized on rural NSW property
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 6
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Plotters, kingmakers and dark horses — the Liberals vying for control
item.description: Parliament House has entered the spill zone, where politics is at its most primal. Here are the Liberals jostling for control of their much-reduced party.

item.title: Reo Te Whetu Marama Marsh pleads guilty to murdering Mary Benedito on Gold Coast
item.description: The 25-year-old mother was found unresponsive in a Southport apartment in 2021 and later died of her injuries in hospital.

item.title: Warrnambool pub fined $150k for numerous gambling regulation breaches
item.description: The breaches included three instances of failing to interact with a patron showing signs of distress that may have related to gambling harm.

item.title: Labor releases audio of Liberal MP backtracking on $495 million cost of living policy at industry event
item.description: South Australia's Treasurer says the Liberal Party has secretly dumped its major $495 million policy less than six weeks out from the state election, with the Opposition arguing it has to wind back Labor's tax due to state budget blowouts.

item.title: Electronic monitoring bill strengthening bail laws passes Qld parliament
item.description: Magistrates will now be able to order children as young as 10 to wear electronic monitoring devices as a bail condition.

item.title: Camels dying from dehydration descend on APY Lands
item.description: Large mobs of camels wreak havoc in remote Indigenous communities as they desperately search for water.

item.title: James Van Der Beek was synonymous with his character. How he embraced it with humour will be his legacy
item.description: James Van Der Beek's death prompts wide-ranging tributes from co-stars and friends who have praised his kindness and humour.

item.title: RBA governor accused by senator of 'gaslighting' Australians on economy
item.description: Reserve Bank governor Michele Bullock fires back at Nationals senator Matt Canavan after he accused her of "gaslighting" Australians over the state of the Australian economy.

item.title: Support firms for Angus Taylor to win Liberal leadership, though Ley expected to achieve 'good result'
item.description: Support is firming for Angus Taylor to topple Opposition Leader Sussan Ley, though her supporters still expect her to achieve a "good result".

item.title: Mother of autistic man starved to death in Gold Coast hospital 'satisfied' with damning investigation
item.description: Queensland’s health watchdog finds Stewart Kelly's 2022 hospital death was the result of systemic failures in care, particularly around responding to his complex needs.

item.title: Chocolate recipes to share some love with the people in your life
item.description: Whether you are into Valentine's Day or not, these chocolate recipes are perfect for sharing some love.

item.title: Julian Assange's brother backs exiled former ASIO spy Marcus amid Bondi Beach gunman radicalisation claims
item.description: Former undercover agent Marcus says he shared intelligence with ASIO about Bondi gunmen Naveed and Sajid Akram's alleged terrorism associations as far back as 2019.

item.title: Liberals' leadership machinations dominate the political week
item.description: The Liberals have spent the week embroiled in leadership woes as the party braces for a spill on Friday morning.

item.title: Ballarat man pleads guilty to taking almost 200 'upskirt' images in public places
item.description: A court hears a man took "upskirting" images of unwitting women and girls in shopping centres and his workplace, in Melbourne, Geelong and Ballarat.

item.title: Two Chinese nationals accused of foreign interference granted bail in ACT Magistrates Court
item.description: Police allege the two Chinese nationals, who are charged with reckless foreign interference for alleged spying on the Canberra branch of a Buddhist association, are linked to a woman arrested on the same charge last year.

item.title: Severe thunderstorm, heavy rainfall warnings issued for Queensland
item.description: Severe thunderstorms are likely to produce heavy rainfall that may lead to flash flooding across parts of Queensland tonight, according to the weather bureau.

item.title: Fatal Queensland house fire inquiry hears father was 'pretty abusive'
item.description: The mother of a young boy killed in a house fire in 2017 has given emotional evidence at an inquest into his death.

item.title: New video shows violent arrest of Australian filmmaker James Ricketson at Sydney's anti-Herzog protest
item.description: New video obtained by ABC NEWS Verify shows in vivid detail the arrest of a 76-year-old man, who was later released without charge.

item.title: Barbeques Galore enters receivership as debt burns into bottom line
item.description: Barbeques Galore has plunged into receivership, leaving question marks for nearly 100 stores that employ about 500 staff.

item.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Gardener accused of killing Darwin mum in yard deemed 'unfit' to face trial, court hears
item.description: A gardener accused of murdering a Darwin mum in her backyard in 2022 has been deemed 'unfit' to face trial. The case has been delayed while investigations into Joerg Kloepper's mental state and ability to plead were conducted.

item.title: Cars submerged, trees torn down, roads inundated: Alice Springs flooding in pictures
item.description: Overnight thunderstorms left Central Australian rivers inundated on Thursday, with rapidly rising floodwaters submerging cars, ripping up trees and leaving multiple people stranded.

item.title: Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit to implement recommendations for workplace culture overhaul
item.description: Staff at the Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit will be implementing recommended changes to their workplace culture following an independent review.

item.title: Live: Teen bounces back from nasty crash to snatch gold from American great
item.description: Two-time Winter Olympic champion Chloe Kim is pipped for first place by 17-year-old Gaon Choi late in the women's snowboard halfpipe final at the Milano Cortina Games. Follow live.

item.title: Father finds family's bones in rubble of Gaza house destroyed in air strikes
item.description: Mahmoud Hammad believes he has found his family's remains in the rubble of his house, which was destroyed more than two years ago in air strikes, killing his pregnant wife and their five children.

item.title: Nightcliff by-election set for March 7, Greens and Labor announce candidates
item.description: The Greens and Labor have announced their candidates for the Nightcliff by-election, set for March 7, after the resignation of Greens MLA Kat McNamara earlier this week.

item.title: Man charged over alleged sexual assault of girl on Adelaide bus
item.description: A 33-year-old man is expected to face an Adelaide court on Friday, after a teenage girl was allegedly sexually assaulted on a public bus earlier this week.

item.title: IOC disqualifies Ukrainian skeleton racer Vladyslav Heraskevych over helmet
item.description: Vladyslav Heraskevych is disqualified over his customised helmet featuring the faces of Ukrainian athletes and coaches killed in the Russia-Ukraine war.

item.title: Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi dazzle fans at Wuthering Heights premiere in Sydney
item.description: Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi were all smiles on the red carpet ahead of the Australian premiere of Wuthering Heights at the State Theatre in Sydney.

item.title: Muslim men had permission to pray before officers removed them from Sydney protest, police say
item.description: A group of Muslim men had already received police permission to worship during a Sydney protest before they were disrupted mid-prayer by officers, NSW Police Force confirms.

item.title: Cooper Woods wins Australia's first gold of 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics
item.description: Cooper Woods has stunned the moguls field to win a maiden career title at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games at Milano Cortina.

item.title: Multiple people stabbed outside Coorparoo's Easts Leagues Club
item.description: A 33-year-old man has been arrested after the incident at Coorparoo's Easts Leagues Club on Thursday evening, which left two people in hospital.

item.title: Cooper Woods welcomed to the Winter Olympic 'gold medal club' by Alisa Camplin-Warner
item.description: Only seven Australian athletes have ever felt the weight of a Winter Olympic gold medal being hung around their necks. And one of the first, Alisa Camplin-Warner, was thrilled to welcome the most recent, Cooper Woods, to the club.

item.title: Judge sets trial date for Donald Trump's defamation case against BBC
item.description: A US District Judge has also rejected the BBC's application to halt the discovery phase of the $US10 billion ($15.1 billion) lawsuit.

item.title: Donald Trump's border tsar Tom Homan announces ICE withdrawal from Minnesota
item.description: An immigration crackdown in the Midwestern state has been marred by protests and public anger after the shooting of two US citizens by federal agents.

item.title: What living in a multigenerational home with one of your parents is really like
item.description: Kay and her daughter Cat moved back in together a year ago — along with Cat's husband and their three kids. This is the reality of what it's like living with three generations under one roof.

item.title: Liberal Party poised to dump first female federal leader
item.description: The Liberal Party is poised to dump its first federal female leader, with Sussan Ley's supporters acknowledging her rival, Angus Taylor, is in the "ascendancy".

item.title: 3,100 aged care patients stranded in hospitals as states again press Commonwealth for action
item.description: With the ink still wet on a new hospital deal, state and territory health ministers will today use a meeting with their federal counterpart to call for urgent action on stranded patients.

item.title: Water utility 'confident' Hobart drinking water is antibiotic-free after salmon disease outbreak
item.description: Tasmania's water provider says there is no risk of antibiotics entering Hobart's water supply, following Huon Aquaculture's use of oxytetracycline in the River Derwent to treat a disease outbreak.

item.title: Men face drug cultivation charges after $10 million cannabis bust in Victoria's north
item.description: Police allege a drug bust in Victoria's north-west has uncovered 10 large grow houses cultivating $10 million worth of illegal cannabis.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: A leadership spill, a ghost barge and mysterious balls
item.description: Have you been paying attention to the headlines this week? Test yourself here.

item.title: Italy wins first T20 Cricket World Cup match as Australian-born players shine in 10-wicket win over Nepal
item.description: Sydney-born brothers Justin and Anthony Mosca have guided T20 World Cup debutants Italy to their first win in the tournament, as their unbeaten half-centuries secured a dominant 10-wicket victory over Nepal on Thursday.

item.title: Cooper Woods, Australia's unexpected Winter Olympic champion, finds his purpose
item.description: Cooper Woods came into the 2026 Winter Olympic Games ranked 22nd in the World Cup rankings in moguls. But in finding his purpose, he roared to a glorious gold medal.

item.title: How the Liberals' first female leader found herself here
item.description: Sussan Ley has had much less than a year to try to prove herself. So how did the Liberals' first female leader find herself on the canvas so quickly and dramatically?

item.title: ASX boss to depart as another controversy unfolds
item.description: A decade of technology failures, unplanned outages, management upheaval, irate investors and the torching of hundreds of millions of dollars has left the ASX's reputation in shreds.

item.title: Epstein victims stand up during House Judiciary Committee hearing
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Epstein survivor says release of files was 're-traumatising' and falls short of transparency
item.description: Lisa Phillips says the publication of the "Epstein" files was meant to deliver long-promised transparency but has instead exposed victims, deepened trauma and continued to shield powerful men.

item.title: Angus Taylor wants to be the new leader of the Liberal Party. Who is he?
item.description: Angus Taylor will challenge Sussan Ley for the leadership of the Liberal Party, saying he no longer has faith that she can lead the party.

item.title: Economist Bruce Preston appointed to RBA Board
item.description: The economics professor is the second academic economist added to the board since a review recommended boosting its expertise.

item.title: The Christchurch terrorist changed New Zealand, now he is testing its legal system
item.description: It may be months before New Zealand finds out if the Christchurch terrorist will be granted an application to have his guilty pleas vacated.

item.title: Lake Cargelligo residents live in fear as Julian Ingram clocks up three weeks on the run
item.description: As alleged triple-murderer Julian Ingram notches up three weeks on the run, residents in the small town are struggling to heal from shootings that rocked the community.

item.title: More than 100 Stolen Generations survivors gather for apology anniversary
item.description: More than 100 Stolen Generations survivors have gathered in Canberra for the apology anniversary. The government is pledging new money to help them heal.

item.title: Marine biologists fight to save endangered seagrass species in Sydney Harbour
item.description: A centuries-old nautical technique is being redesigned within a small Sydney cove in a bid to save a tiny remnant population of a dying species.

item.title: Intense rainfall risk for south-east Queensland as whole state set for 'wet and stormy' weekend
item.description: South-east Queensland is being told to brace for an intense soaking from today, with up to 200 millimetres to fall in some coastal areas, with rainfall all weekend.

item.title: The 'farm-fluencers' taking agriculture online to bridge the rural divide
item.description: Farmers and agricultural workers are taking to social media to educate a new audience while building a community.

item.title: Queensland police given greater powers to pursue animal abusers
item.description: Queensland police will be able to pursue animal abusers without seeking permission from a government department after regulation change.

item.title: Cost-of-living crisis sees more young women neglecting health and basic needs, report finds
item.description: A study from Deakin University has found many young women admit skipping meals or forgoing medical attention to save money.

item.title: Openly gay men in elite sport are rare, leaving women to lead the way for queer inclusion
item.description: While high profile instances of homophobia in elite men's sport continue, leading female athletes are hoping to help create more inclusive spaces for all.

item.title: Four charged after $10 million cannabis crop busted in Victoria's north-west
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Live: Liberals count down to pivotal leadership meeting
item.description: Liberals are set to decide the party's future leader as Angus Taylor moves to contest Sussan Ley's leadership. Follow live.

item.title: Kim Jong Un set to pick daughter Kim Ju Ae to lead North Korea, South Korean intelligence says
item.description: South Korea's spy agency says that Kim Jong Un is set to choose his daughter as his heir, extending his family's rule into a fourth generation.

item.title: Max Verstappen critical of new Formula 1 cars as preseason testing continues
item.description: Four-time Formula 1 world champion Max Verstappen says the 2026 cars are "not so fun", claiming the increasing energy management demands on drivers are "just not Formula 1".

item.title: NT Australian of the Year Dr Felix Ho volunteers thousands of hours each year
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: NT Australian of the Year Felix Ho volunteers thousands of hours to the community each year
item.description: Finding time to volunteer can be a stretch for most people, but for Darwin doctor Felix Ho, who volunteers thousands of hours every year, it's his "full-time hobby".

item.title: Live: AUD back below 71 US cents as 'old economy' fears grow
item.description: The local currency is back below 70 US cents again, and CBA's currency analysts think it could highlight things to come in 2026. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Thai raid finds Cambodian scam centre had personal details of 300 Australians
item.description: Australia's National Anti-Scam Centre says documents seized in a raid on a Cambodian scam compound contained the phone numbers, names and addresses of 300 Australians.
